translated: Jātaka
The Collection of Birth Stories in Eleven Books
The Chapter on Mother’s Keeper🔽The Water-Drinking Birth Story
“A friend drank water that was not given,
and I did the same.
Later I felt disgust,
and that bad deed was done by me.
I will not do bad deeds again,
and so I have gone forth.
Having seen another’s wife,
desire arose in me.
Later I felt disgust,
and that bad deed was done by me.
I will not do bad deeds again,
and so I have gone forth.
Great king, my father
was seized by thieves in the forest.
When asked, I knew
but gave a false answer.
Later I felt disgust,
and that bad deed was done by me.
I will not do bad deeds again,
and so I have gone forth.
I committed killing,
at the time of the Soma sacrifice.
I approved of it.
Later I felt disgust,
and that bad deed was done by me.
I will not do bad deeds again,
and so I have gone forth.
Intoxicating drinks,

original: ye janā paṭhamāsu no;🔽Bahūnaṁ te anatthāya,
analyzed: ye janā paṭhamāsu naḥ  bahūnam te anatthāya
translated: Those people who were first of all🔽Were for the harm of many,
They made a plan to drink alcohol,
I approved of that.
Later I despised that,
That evil was done by me;
May I not do evil again,
Therefore I went forth.”
“Shame on sensual pleasures, Subāhu,
They are foul-smelling, with many thorns,
Having enjoyed them,
I did not obtain such happiness.”
“Sensual pleasures are very delightful,
There is no happiness greater than sensual pleasures;
Those who enjoy sensual pleasures,
They are reborn in heaven.”
“Sensual pleasures are of little taste, they are suffering,
There is no suffering greater than sensual pleasures;
Those who enjoy sensual pleasures,
They are reborn in hell.

original: Asī yathā sunisito,🔽nettiṁsova supāyiko;🔽Sattīva urasi khittā,
analyzed: asī yathā su nisitaḥ  nettisaḥ uva su pāyikaḥ  urasi khittā
translated: Like a razor’s edge,🔽Like a sword’s edge,🔽Like a knife,

analyzed: kāmā dukkhatarā tato  aṅgāra anava jalita  kāsum sādhikaporisa
translated: Sensual pleasures are more painful than that.🔽Like burning coals,🔽Like a hot iron ball,
Like a ploughshare heated all day,

analyzed: kāmā dukkhatarā tato  visam yathā halāhala
translated: Sensual pleasures are more painful than that.🔽Like the poison halāhala,
Like boiling oil,
Sensual pleasures are more painful than that,
like molten metal.”
The Birth Story of Pānīya is the fifth.
